featured.text: Thus, daydreams are really just waking thoughts.
Every morning, these people, often older in age, were seen in big streets and small alleys, waking up their customers professionally.
24 these “non-dreamers” do their sleeping in a laboratory 25 researchers can wake them up and ask them whether they were having dreams the moment before, it 26 that they dream as much as others.
Anyway, it was not (39) 10 o’clock the next morning that I finally woke up.

other.text: In 21 , the brain waves of a sleeping person are similar to those of a waking person, and the eyes move about rapidly under the closed lids.
After all, you can’t wake up a lion!
17 sticks or pea shooters, the human alarms would tour the streets, tap on windows, or blast them with dried peas, trying to wake paying customers in time for work.
All the obstacles of reality can be set aside and you are able to accomplish tasks that you could never manage in waking reality.

definition.en_def: To emerge or cause to emerge from sleep; to become alert or aware.
definition.example: I usually wake up at 7 AM every day.
